content.description: The degrees of relatedness in several native populations of prairie chickens in Marion and Jasper Counties in Illinois were determined. The degree of relatedness is inversely proportional to genetic diversity; that is, populations with a high degree of relatedness have less genetic diversity. Table 1 shows the collected data. Populations <math alttext="J 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>J</mtext><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> through <math alttext="J 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>J</mtext><mn>5</mn></mrow></math> are located in Jasper County. Populations <math alttext="M 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> through <math alttext="M 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mn>5</mn></mrow></math> are located in Marion County. Numbers above 0.125 indicate a high degree of relatedness.
content.question: Table 1. RELATEDNESS OF PRAIRIE CHICKEN POPULATIONS Population Degree of Relatedness <math alttext="J 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>J</mtext><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> 0.215 <math alttext="J 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>J</mtext><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> 0.215 <math alttext="J 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>J</mtext><mn>3</mn></mrow></math> 0.339 <math alttext="J 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>J</mtext><mn>4</mn></mrow></math> 0.280 <math alttext="J 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>J</mtext><mn>5</mn></mrow></math> 0.362 <math alttext="M 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> 0.305 <math alttext="M 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> 0.365 <math alttext="M 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mtext></mtext><mn>3</mn></mrow></math> 0.199 <math alttext="M 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mn>4</mn></mrow></math> 0.432 <math alttext="M 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mn>5</mn></mrow></math> 0.405 Scientists claim that some of the populations in Marion County are at an increased risk of decline or extinction. Based on the data in table 1, which of the following best provides evidence to support this claim?

choices.label: The Marion County populations have a higher rate of mutation than the Jasper County populations, as evidenced by the higher degrees of relatedness.
The Marion County populations are less stable because they are smaller than the Jasper County populations.

The <math alttext="M 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mn>2</mn></mrow></math> population has a higher degree of relatedness than the <math alttext="M 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mn>1</mn></mrow></math> population, meaning that it has more genetic diversity.

The <math alttext="M 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M4</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="M 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mn>5</mn></mrow></math> populations have the lowest genetic diversity of all populations.

content.answer: The <math alttext="M 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>M4</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="M 5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>M</mtext><mn>5</mn></mrow></math> populations have the lowest genetic diversity of all populations.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
